danger.prompt: While at work, you are performing maintenance on one of the generators. You are pretty sure you can skip the maintenance since nobody has used the generator since the last maintenance a couple months ago.
outcomes: You skip the maintenance. A couple weeks later your team turns on the generator and it immediately explodes, killing one and injuring several others. You are near the blast radius and get hit by high-velocity shrapnel. Management is then forced to pay out worker's compensation to the victims, including you.

You finish the maintenance. You turn on the generator for the final test and it explodes. You are standing very close and receive several serious burns and shrapnel. Management is forced to pay out worker's compensation to you.

danger.prompt: You are making your way downtown, walking fast, the faces pass as you're home bound. Your boss calls you and asks you to take a higher position with the company. The pay is a lot more, but it is extremely risky. What do you do?
outcomes: Three days into the new job, a tragedy occurs. You lose some limbs and are on life support. It doesn't look good for you.
Your boss fires you the next day. The company needs to go with someone who is willing to take risks.

passion.prompt: You are in your art studio, putting the finishing touches on your latest work. You need to decide what to do with it when it's finished.
outcomes: You take your finished piece to the gallery for sale. It takes about five months before a local high-roller makes an offer.
You donate your art to one of your favorite charities. On your way back home, the charity owner calls you and requests several personal commissioned artworks.
You hang the art from the ceiling in your foyer. A few months later, an earthquake causes the art to fall right on your head. You'll need to go to the hospital to get this looked at.

passion.prompt: You are teaching students your craft. They love it, you love it, but the money is not enough to pay your bills. A student asks why wont you quit. Pick your response
options: passion is more important than money
quit your job and get more money
outcomes: You get more students, but the money is still terrible. You start selling drugs on the side to supplement income
You are making more money, but the stress has caused you ulcers.

knowledge.prompt: One day while in the office, you are heading to the restroom. You round a corner and bump into the new secretary, Anne. She drops the notepad and coffee mug she was holding onto the carpet, spilling coffee everywhere.
outcomes: 'A case of the Mondays, huh?', you say to Anne. She glares and you continue to the restroom. On your way back to your desk, you find a credit card in the coffee stain. Anne must not have realized she dropped it.

You bend to help Anne pick up her items. She thanks you for your help and asks if you want to get lunch. You become great friends with her and her family. You find out her father owns the company and your friendly relationship with him gets you a promotion.

knowledge.prompt: Its time to clock in! You make amazing money, but you are miserable at your job. You work from home and as you sit in front of your desk, you contemplate leaving. You sign in to your Zoom meeting.
outcomes: You have gone viral. Your video has garnered national attention. You now have endorsements and are working for yourself
Your boss gives you a shout out. They are so happy to have you. You smile on the outside, but on the inside, its the opposite effect
